thread.title: Ruby Rose Opens Up About Her Choice Not to Transition; Sandra Bullock Raises $84,850 for Charity - Style.com New
thread.title_full: Ruby Rose Opens Up About Her Choice Not to Transition; Sandra Bullock Raises $84,850 for Charity - Style.com New

author: Zoe Anastasiou
title: Ruby Rose Opens Up About Her Choice Not to Transition; Sandra Bullock Raises $84,850 for Charity - Style.com New
text:
Photo: Getty Images
Ruby Rose on gender fluidity…
Australian model-actress Ruby Rose sat down with Access Hollywood to discuss gender fluidity and her newfound fame. The Orange Is the New Black star admitted she contemplated gender transition when she was a child, divulging that she even had a savings jar in which she collected money for her surgery. However, around age 15, Rose says she changed her mind: “I started to change the way that I dressed and talked, and realized that I didn’t want to transition; I just wanted to be more comfortable in my own skin.” [ Access Hollywood ]
Raising money with Minions …
Sandra Bullock is raising money for charity with a little help from her minions. The actress auctioned off 10 pairs of yellow Rupert Sanderson-designed shoes inspired by the movie Minions, raising $42,425 for the Art + Practice charity. Bullock then matched the amount, bringing the total donated to $84,850. [ British Vogue ]
Inside the couture ateliers…
In the handmade world of couture clothing, each item is delicately constructed. “You have to be very meticulous. Details are important,” explained Federica Papalini, one of 75 seamstresses employed at Valentino. “But you have incredible teachers in the girls who have more experience.” A new photo essay visits the couture ateliers of Valentino, Dior, and Jean Paul Gaultier to deliver an inside look at the creation of haute couture masterpieces and the women who make them. [ The Cut ]
Eytys heads to Israel…
Footwear company Eytys has debuted its new ad campaign, which features models scouted on the streets of Isreal with their families. The Dafy Hagai-lensed images were shot in the country’s picturesque desert, steering clear of any political turmoil. [ Complex ]
Qwartz mall held up by gunmen…
The Primark clothing store in the Qwartz shopping mall, located just north of Paris, was held up by armed gunmen today. According to reports, the robbery took place around 6:30 this morning and about 10 hostages were taken. Luckily, special forces intervened and the situation came to an end. Per a spokesperson, the perpetrators are still at large. [ WWD ]
